sub_title: Assistant Professor and Epidemiologist at University Medical Center Utrecht

treasury_media.title: PubMed - Erik Timmermans
treasury_media.description: Overview of my peer-reviewed publications in international scientific journals.

treasury_media.title: Exposome-NL (www.exposome.nl)
treasury_media.description: Exposome-NL is a Dutch consortium of over fifty scientists from different disciplines, universities and medical centres. Together the scientists will systematically sequence the environmental factors influencing our health.

treasury_media.title: SURREAL Project (www.surreal-itn.eu)
treasury_media.description: The SURREAL consortium (www.surreal-itn.eu) aims to gain a solid interdisciplinary and intersectoral understanding of the complex relationships between exposures to urban environments, behaviours and health, and to identify how this knowledge can be used for effective interventions at the individual and the urban level to improve health and health equity.

treasury_media.title: The Geoscience and Health Cohort Consortium (GECCO; www.gecco.nl)
treasury_media.description: The Geoscience and Health Cohort Consortium (GECCO; www.gecco.nl) is a Dutch infrastructure to support researchers to study the relation between environmental characteristics and health. In GECCO, 25 cohort studies are enriched with objectively measured environmental data.

treasury_media.title: COST Action PhysAgeNet (www.physagenet.eu)
treasury_media.description: The main aim of the COST Action PhysAgeNet is to establish a sustainable network that will foster evidence-based research and practice of physical activity in older adults and will enhance integration of innovative ICT solutions based on open data consolidated research information, in order to promote health and reduce the burden of inactivity in ageing populations.

treasury_media.title: MINDMAP - Promoting mental well-being and healthy ageing in cities (www.mindmap-cities.eu)
treasury_media.description: The MINDMAP study (www.mindmap-cities.eu) is an international multi-cohort study focusing on the impact of the environment on mental functioning of older adults.

treasury_media.title: Longitudinal Aging Study Amsterdam (LASA; www.lasas-vu.nl)
treasury_media.description: The Longitudinal Aging Study Amsterdam (LASA) is a scientific study to determine predictors and consequences of aging. Since 1992, LASA has studied the physical, emotional, cognitive and social functioning of older adults in the Netherlands. Within LASA the interdependence of these domains of functioning and of the changes that occur over time is being investigated. Over the years LASA has built up an enormous data source on aging in the Netherlands.

treasury_media.title: Longitudinal Aging Study Amsterdam (LASA; www.lasa-vu.nl)
treasury_media.description: The Longitudinal Aging Study Amsterdam (LASA; www.lasa-vu.nl) is a longitudinal cohort study focusing on the determinants, trajectories and consequences of physical, cognitive, emotional and social functioning in older adults in the Netherlands.

treasury_media.title: The European Project on Osteoarthritis (EPOSA; www.eposa.org)
treasury_media.description: The European Project on Osteoarthritis (EPOSA; www.eposa.org) focuses on the individual and societal consequences of osteoarthritis in older adults from six European countries.

authors.headline: Assistant Professor and Epidemiologist at University Medical Center Utrecht

profile_positions.description:
Currently, I work as an Assistant Professor at the Department of Global Public Health and Bioethics of the Julius Center for Health Sciences and Primary Care of the UMC Utrecht in Utrecht, the Netherlands. In this role, I am involved in research projects of various consortia:

* Senior researcher and copromotor in Exposome-NL (www.exposome.nl). This is a Dutch consortium focusing on how the exposome affects cardiometabolic health. 

* Supervisory Board Member and copromotor in the SURREAL consortium (www.surreal-itn.eu). This international consortium aims to gain a solid interdisciplinary and intersectoral understanding of the complex relationships between exposures to urban environments, behaviours and health, and to identify how this knowledge can be used for effective interventions at the individual and the urban level to improve health and health equity.

* Senior researcher in the Heart Brain Connection Consortium (www.hart-brein.nl/). The Heart-Brain Study investigates the relationships between (cardio-)vascular factors, the hemodynamic status of the heart and the brain, and cognitive impairment using data from controls and patients with disorders along the Heart-Brain Axis. My work package focused on improving our understanding of the relations between environmental factors, hemodynamic status of the brain, cardiovascular health, and cognitive functioning.

* Senior researcher in the European COST Action ‘Network on evidence-based physical activity in old age’ (PhysAgeNet; www.physagenet.eu).

* Senior researcher in the iSense project 'Urban vitality (in Jerusalem) in the age of smart cities'.

Teaching activities:
- CVD Epidemiology, Epidemiology (MSc, 2022, 2023)
- Clinical Epidemiology, Honours Programme, Medicine (BSc, 2021, 2022)
- Clinical Scientific Research, Medicine (BSc, 2022)

Other activities:
- Selected for UMCU Talent Program 2023-2024
- Co-organizer of Annual meeting Circulatory Health (2022-2023)
- Co-organizer of SURREAL network school (2022)
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor

profile_positions.description:
From July 2017 to June 2021, I worked as a postdoctoral researcher in the Epidemiology of Aging research group at the department of Epidemiology and Data Science of the Amsterdam UMC (Location: VU University medical center) in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. In this role, I was involved in research projects of the Longitudinal Aging Study Amsterdam (LASA; www.lasa-vu.nl), an ongoing cohort study on the determinants, trajectories and consequences of physical, cognitive, emotional and social functioning in older adults.

* Co-founder/steering group member of the Geoscience and Health Cohort Consortium (GECCO; www.gecco.nl), a Dutch infrastructure to support researchers to study the relation between environmental characteristics and health.

* Project member of MINDMAP (www.mindmap-cities.eu), an international consortium focusing on the impact of the urban environment on mental functioning of older adults. 

* Project leader of a NWA-IDG research project on the associations of changes in the built environment with changes in physical activity over time in older adults.

* Project member of the European Project on OSteoArthritis (www.eposa.org), a consortium focusing on the personal and societal burden of osteoarthritis in older adults in Europe.

* Teaching activities:
- Advanced Epidemiology, Epidemiology (MSc, 2020, 2021)
- Doctor & Patient IV, Medicine (BSc, 2020)
- Epidemiology & Biostatistics II, Health Sciences (BSc, 2019)
- Human Life Cycle II, Human Health and Life Sciences (BSc, 2021)
- Medical Scientific Research I, Medicine (BSc, 2017, 2018, 2020)
- Medical Scientific Research II, Medicine (BSc, 2018-2021)
- Methodology II, Human Health and Life Sciences (BSc, 2019)
- BSc theses supervisor

* Other activities:
- Member of APH Scientific Quality Committee (2020, 2021)
- Chair of Symposium “25 years LASA” (2017)
- Co-organizer of LASA Advisory Board Meeting (2019)
- Co-organizer of Aging & Later Life symposium (2019)
- Member of LASA Website Committee (2019-2021)
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description:
From November 2016 to June 2017, I worked as a postdoctoral researcher at the department of Public Health of the Academic Medical Centre (AMC) in Amsterdam. In this position, I was involved in two research projects of the Health Behaviour and Chronic Disease (HBCD) programme of the Amsterdam Public Health (APH) research institute. These two projects are:

* Enrichment and use of environmental data from the Geoscience and Health Cohort Consortium (GECCO; www.gecco.nl)
  
* Mapping the potential health benefits  of smoking cessation across specific population subgroups.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description:
From November 2012 to October 2016, I worked as a PhD candidate in the Epidemiology of Aging research group at the department of Epidemiology and Biostatistics of the VU University medical center in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. I was involved in research projects of the Longitudinal Aging Study Amsterdam (LASA; www.lasa-vu.nl). In my position as a PhD candidate, I worked on the European Project on OSteoArthritis (EPOSA; www.eposa.org). The EPOSA project studies the personal and societal burden and its determinants of osteoarthritis in the aging European population using data from six population-based cohort studies across Europe (Germany, Italy, the Netherlands, Spain, Sweden and the United Kingdom).

The title of my PhD thesis is:
'The impact of the outdoor physical environment on older adults with osteoarthritis'

Promotor: prof. dr. D.J.H. Deeg
Copromotors: dr. S. van der Pas & dr. L.A. Schaap

Teaching activities:
- Geriatrics and Aging, Health Sciences (BSc, 2013, 2016)
- Medical Scientific Research I, Medicine (BSc, 2015)
- Medical Scientific Research II, Medicine (BSc, 2016)
- Scientific Research Skills I, Medicine (BSc, 2013, 2014)
- Scientific Research Skills II, Medicine (BSc, 2015)
- Personal Development and Science, Medicine (BSc, 2016)
- BSc theses supervisor

Other activities:
- Auditor for the EMGO+ Quality Committee (2014-2016)
- Research internship at the University of Southampton (2014)
- Chair of the LASA PhD Committee (2013-2016)
- Co-organizier of the LASA Advisory Board Meeting (2016)
- Member of the LASA Website Committee (2014-2016)
profile_positions.title: PhD candidate

profile_positions.description:
From April 2015 to March 2016, I worked part-time as a postdoctoral researcher in the EMGO+ Cohort Booster Project / Geoscience and Health Cohort Consortium (GECCO; www.gecco.nl). In this project, I identified, collected, and processed existing objectively measured environmental data for six cohort-studies within the EMGO Institute for Health and Care Research (EMGO+ Institute) of the VU University medical center in Amsterdam, the Netherlands.

The six cohort-studies are: 
- Generations2
- Longitudinal Aging Study Amsterdam (LASA)
- Netherlands Longitudinal Study on Hearing (NL-SH)
- Netherlands Study of Depression and Anxiety (NESDA)
- Netherlands Twin Register (NTR)
- New Hoorn Study (NHS)

Between 2018 and 2021, GECCO has been extended to 25 cohort studies in the Netherlands (www.gecco.nl).
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description: In my position as a postdoctoral researcher at the department of Epidemiology and Data Science (Amsterdam UMC, location VUmc), I have visited the Department of Global Health and Social Medicine of King's College London in London, United Kingdom. Together with colleagues from the MINDMAP project (www.mindmap-cities.eu), I have evaluated the impact of an urban regeneration programme on various indicators of functioning among older adults in the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Visiting researcher

profile_positions.description: As part of my PhD-project, I did a research internship at the MRC Lifecourse Epidemiology Unit of the University of Southampton, United Kingdom. This internship was supported by a personal travel grant from the EMGO Institute for Health and Care Research of the VU University Medical Center in Amsterdam, the Netherlands (EMGO+ Travel Grant 2014-2015).
profile_positions.title: Visiting researcher

profile_positions.description:
In my position as a teaching-/ research assistant at the Center for Human Movement Sciences of the University Medical Center Groningen (UMCG), I prepared several courses and supervised BSc- and MSc-students during lectures and practicals. In addition, I performed several activities for the Self-evaluation Committee for Human Movement Sciences and I tested cognitive abilities of primary school children for two research projects.

As a teaching-/ research assistant, I was involved in the following courses/workshop:
- Advanced Statistics, Human Movement Sciences (MSc, 2011)
- Development of a Movement Programme, Human Movement Sciences (BSc, 2011)
- Project ‘Fit en Vaardig op School’, Human Movement Sciences (2012)
- Project ‘Hoe Fitter, Hoe Slimmer’, Human Movement Sciences (2012)
- Introduction & Practicals Methodology and Statistics, Human Movement Sciences (BSc, 2011, 2012)
- Introduction to teaching, Human Movement Sciences (BSc, 2012)
- Models, Human Movement Sciences (MSc, 2012)
- Multilevel Analysis, Human Movement Sciences (MSc, 2012)
- Special Pathology, Human Movement Sciences (MSc, 2012)
- Statistics I, Human Movement Sciences (BSc, 2012)
- Statistics II, Human Movement Sciences (BSc, 2012)
- Workshop ‘Emotional contagion in the soccer penalty shoot-out’ (the Night of Arts and Sciences 2012 in Groningen)
profile_positions.title: Teaching- / research assistant

profile_positions.description:
In my position as a student assistant at the Center for Human Movement Sciences of the University Medical Center Groningen (UMCG), I supervised groups of BSc. students during their practicals. During the course Introduction to teaching (Mentor/Tutor system), I was involved in supervising various groups of first year BSc-students. As part of this task, I acquired several teaching skills (mentor group sessions, individual supervising, feedback and assessment and didactic trainings).

As a student assistant, I was involved in the following courses:
- Introduction to teaching, Human Movement Sciences (BSc, 2011)
- Neuro anatomy I, Human Movement Sciences (BSc, 2009)
- Neuro anatomy II, Human Movement Sciences (BSc, 2009)
- Statistics I, Human Movement Sciences (BSc, 2010, 2011)
profile_positions.title: Student assistant

2017/2018: Senior football trainer of a senior football team (under-21)
